page.title: 07The River Thame
page.content: The River Thame flows through the area from Ickford Bridge to Shabbington in a wide loop that runs round Manor Farm, Shabbington.It often floods its banks in wet weather and the fields can be seen flooded from the A418.In winter it flows very fast and at Ickford Bridge it is about 10ft wide but is only 2m wide at Shabbington.We saw a kingfisher at Ickford and ducks,coots,and moorhen can be seen at The Old Fisherman Pub at Shabbington,which is popular with children as the river runs through the pub garden which has swings,and the river is shallow enough to paddle.Here too is a floodmarker.In wet winters the river floods the road and a raised walkway is next to the road for walkers each side of the river.A London Piscatorial Society fishes the river here.We saw two types of dragonfly in the reeds by the riverbank.
